result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt: Atty Amanda Nimmer
Review hearing on November 1, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Competency to be signed by CC Rieck

1:40 PM Defendant James R Mueller in court, in custody.  Attorney Amanda Marie Nimmer in court for James R Mueller.  Prosecuting attorney Andrew Nesheim in court for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant is eligible for State Public Defender representation.  An attorney will be appointed.  DEFENSE COUNSEL REQUESTS ORDER FOR COMPETENCY PURSUANT TO SEC.. 971.14(2).  Court grants request and orders the defendant be examined by the Wisconsin Forensic Unit.  To be done as an outpatient basis within 30 days.   Defendant does not have a current address but does have a valid phone number.
Review hearing scheduled for November 1, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Waukesha County Public Safety Assessment Report filed by Wisconsin Community Services.
EXT CODE 3.
Signature bond ordered to be forfeited in the amount of $1000.00

4:26 PM Prosecuting attorney Mary Caitlin Brejcha in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant James R Mueller not in court. 

State motions the Court to issue a warrant for the defendant and to forfeit bail.
The Court will issue a bench warrant and forfeit bail.
EXT CODE 3.
Letter filed by Penny Frederick, re: her son's case
Effective August 1, 2022, this case is assigned to Branch 4, the Honorable Lloyd V. Carter, pursuant to 22-SO-04(67).

Pre-trial conference on August 12, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
*Notice was not mailed as defendant's address is listed as homeless.

Defendant to comply with I.D. Processing.  Defendant to have no contact with Kwik Trip/Stein's Gardens and Gifts/American Fireworks listed in the Criminal Complaint.  Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed.  Defendant not to possess any drug paraphernalia.

03:26 PM Defendant James R Mueller in court, in custody, with attorney Eryn M Menden.    District Attorney's Office Law Intern Alyssa Jay appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Menden appears as friend of the court.  Defense acknowledges receipt of complaint and waives reading of complaint.  Service admitted/advised of charges and potential penalties.  Court advises of right to an attorney.  NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED BY COURT.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for August 12, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
